source_file: ASSASSINATION OF A HIGH SCHOOL PRESIDENT.pdf

metadata.filename: ASSASSINATION OF A HIGH SCHOOL PRESIDENT.pdf

analysis.title: Assassination of a High School President
analysis.author: Tim Calpin & Kevin Jakubowski
analysis.logline: A sophomore school newspaper reporter uncovers a complex conspiracy involving SAT theft, drug dealing, and corruption at his Catholic high school.

concept.justification: Unique noir-style high school investigative narrative with sharp satirical edge

structure.justification: Well-constructed mystery with clear act breaks and progressive revelations

protagonist.justification: Bobby Funke has clear goal, agency, distinctive voice, and compelling character arc

supporting_cast.justification: Richly developed ensemble with distinct personalities and complex motivations

dialogue.justification: Razor-sharp, quotable lines with strong noir-style narration and distinct character voices

genre_execution.justification: Effectively blends high school comedy with noir investigation, delivers genre expectations

originality.justification: Fresh take on high school genre, subverts expectations with noir storytelling approach

major_weaknesses: Dark tone might limit teen audience

target_audience.note: Teen/young adult market with sophisticated comedy taste

high_concept.note: Easily pitchable premise with unique angle

cast_attachability.note: Ensemble roles attractive to emerging actors

marketing_hook.note: Provocative title and premise create instant curiosity

budget_return_ratio.note: Low production costs, potential cult following

comparable_success.note: Similar to Brick, but with more comedic approach

structure_analysis.act_breaks: Inciting incident around page 15, midpoint twist around page 60, climax around page 100

characters.protagonist: Bobby Funke - sophomore journalist with noir detective sensibilities, seeking truth and professional validation
characters.antagonist: Marlon Piazza - student council VP running complex drug and grade-manipulation operation
supporting: Paul Moore - framed student body president
Rocky Raccoon - philosophical suspension room resident

standout_scenes.why: Unexpected tonal shift, reveals deeper character complexity

standout_scenes.scene: Investigative montage revealing drug ring's origins
standout_scenes.why: Clever narrative construction, delivers complex exposition

comparable_films.title: Brick
comparable_films.similarity: Noir detective style in high school setting

budget_tier.justification: Primarily high school locations, young cast, minimal production requirements

weaknesses: Complex narrative might confuse some viewers
development_notes: Clarify narrative complexity in early acts
assessment.recommendation_rationale: Exceptionally well-crafted screenplay demonstrating sophisticated storytelling, distinctive voice, and strong commercial potential. Weighted score and commercial viability strongly support development.

analysis.verdict_statement: Based on its razor-sharp wit, innovative narrative structure, and compelling protagonist, this screenplay demonstrates commercial viability and craft execution that warrant immediate development consideration. Bobby Funke presents a uniquely attachable lead role that could launch emerging talent.

tmdb_status.tmdb_title: Assassination of a High School President
